Topics: A statement that the study involves research
Questions:
Which of the following statements best describes the nature of the activity you are being asked to participate in according to the consent form?

A) A routine medical check-up with your primary care physician.
B) A research study aimed at understanding resilience in older adults with late-stage lung cancer.
C) A commercial survey for marketing purposes.
D) A social gathering for community support without any data collection.

Correct answer: B) A research study aimed at understanding resilience in older adults with late-stage lung cancer.

Topics: An explanation of the purposes of the research
The expected duration of the subject's participation
Questions:
For approximately how many weeks will participants be involved in the "Resilience Measurement, Prediction, and its Role in Older Adults with Late-Stage Lung Cancer" study?
A) 8 weeks; B) 12 weeks; C) 16 weeks; D) 20 weeks
Correct answer: B) 12 weeks

Topics: Any additional costs to the subject that may result from participation in the research
Questions:
Which of the following statements is true regarding any additional costs to the subject for participating in the "Resilience Measurement, Prediction, and its Role in Older Adults with Late-Stage Lung Cancer" study?

A) Participants will have to pay for the tablet computer (iPad) used for video conferencing.
B) Participants will incur costs for the assessments and questionnaires completed during the study.
C) There are no additional costs to participants as a result of being in this study.
D) Participants will be responsible for the costs of video conferencing sessions.

Correct answer: C) There are no additional costs to participants as a result of being in this study.

Topics: A description of the procedures to be followed
Questions:
How many video conference sessions are participants expected to complete as part of the study intervention, and what is the approximate duration of each session?

A) Up to six sessions, each lasting 20-30 minutes.
B) Up to twelve sessions, each lasting 30-45 minutes.
C) Up to ten sessions, each lasting 45-60 minutes.
D) Up to eight sessions, each lasting 15-20 minutes.

Correct answer: B) Up to twelve sessions, each lasting 30-45 minutes.

Topics: The consequences of a subject's decision to withdraw from the research and procedures for orderly termination of participation by the subject
Questions:
What will happen if you choose to withdraw from the "Resilience Measurement, Prediction, and its Role in Older Adults with Late-Stage Lung Cancer" study?
A) You will be required to pay for any costs incurred up to the point of withdrawal; B) You will lose access to medical care at Duke University; C) Your withdrawal will not affect your entitlement to benefits or access to health care at Duke; D) You will be obligated to continue participating in other Duke University research studies.

Correct answer: C

Topics: Identification of any procedures which are experimental
Questions:
Which of the following is considered an experimental procedure in the study described in the consent form?
A) Regular medical care through current providers; B) Use of an accelerometer to monitor physical activity before, during, and after the intervention; C) Completion of questionnaires and assessments related to lung cancer treatment; D) Self-System Therapy sessions conducted via video conferencing

Correct answer: D

Topics: The approximate number of subjects involved in the study
Questions:
How many older adults are expected to participate in the Resilience Measurement, Prediction, and its Role in Older Adults with Late-Stage Lung Cancer study at Duke University?
A) 10; B) 15; C) 20; D) 25
Correct answer: B

Topics: A description of any reasonably foreseeable risks or discomforts to the subject
Questions:
What is a potential risk or discomfort that participants may experience during the Resilience Measurement, Prediction, and its Role in Older Adults with Late-Stage Lung Cancer study?
A) Physical injury from the medical procedures; B) Increased distress from discussing personal topics; C) Exposure to high levels of radiation; D) Financial costs for participating in the study sessions

Correct answer: B

Topics: A description of any benefits to the subject or to others which may reasonably be expected from the research
Questions:
Which of the following is a potential benefit that participants may experience from the "Resilience Measurement, Prediction, and its Role in Older Adults with Late-Stage Lung Cancer" study?

A) Guaranteed improvement in physical health and elimination of cancer symptoms
B) Direct financial compensation for participation in the study
C) Possible improvement in coping with pain and other symptoms related to lung cancer
D) Assurance of complete confidentiality with no risk of information disclosure

Correct answer: C

Topics: A disclosure of appropriate alternative procedures or courses of treatment, if any, that might be advantageous to the subject
Questions:
If you choose not to participate in the "Resilience Measurement, Prediction, and its Role in Older Adults with Late-Stage Lung Cancer" study, what alternative options for care and support are available to you?
A) You will be provided with a different set of educational materials and support sessions; B) You will continue to receive medical care through your current providers and should maintain contact with them; C) You will be enrolled in a different research study with a focus on medication management; D) No alternative care options will be provided outside of the study.

Correct answer: B

Topics: A statement describing the extent, if any, to which confidentiality of records identifying the subject will be maintained
Questions:
Which of the following statements best describes the confidentiality measures for participants' information in this study?
A) Participants' personal information will be shared publicly on the study's website.
B) All efforts will be made to ensure confidentiality, but it cannot be guaranteed due to the nature of the study.
C) Personal information will be disclosed to any third-party requestor without participant consent.
D) The study guarantees complete confidentiality and there is no risk of information disclosure.

Correct answer: B

Topics: For research involving more than minimal risk, an explanation as to whether any compensation, and an explanation as to whether any medical treatments are available, if injury occurs and, if so, what they consist of, or where further information may be obtained
Questions:
If you experience an injury as a result of participating in the "Resilience Measurement, Prediction, and its Role in Older Adults with Late-Stage Lung Cancer" study, which of the following statements is true regarding compensation and medical treatment?

A) Duke University will provide free medical care and monetary compensation for any study-related injury.
B) There is a commitment by Duke University to provide monetary compensation for study-related injuries, but not free medical care.
C) Immediate necessary medical care is available at Duke University Medical Center for study-related injuries, but there is no commitment to provide monetary compensation or free medical care.
D) All medical treatments and monetary compensation for study-related injuries will be covered by your personal insurance without any support from Duke University.

Correct answer: C) Immediate necessary medical care is available at Duke University Medical Center for study-related injuries, but there is no commitment to provide monetary compensation or free medical care.

Topics: Research, Rights or Injury: An explanation of whom to contact for answers to pertinent questions about the research and research subjects' rights, and whom to contact in the event of a research-related injury to the subject

A statement that participation is voluntary, refusal to participate will involve no penalty or loss of benefits to which the subject is otherwise entitled, and the subject may discontinue participation at any time without penalty or loss of benefits, to which the subject is otherwise entitled
Questions:
What will happen if you decide to withdraw from the "Resilience Measurement, Prediction, and its Role in Older Adults with Late-Stage Lung Cancer" study after initially agreeing to participate?
A) You will incur a penalty and may lose benefits to which you are otherwise entitled.
B) You will not be able to receive healthcare from Duke University anymore.
C) You will not face any penalty or loss of benefits to which you are otherwise entitled.
D) Your access to health care at Duke will be affected, and you may lose your job if you are a Duke employee.

Correct answer: C) You will not face any penalty or loss of benefits to which you are otherwise entitled.
